item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, March 16, 2025 at 9:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Our Interfaces Have Lost Their Senses (149 points | 62 comments)
2. Zlib-rs is faster than C (104 points | 85 comments)
3. Docs – Open source alternative to Notion or Outline (850 points | 294 comments)
4. Tcl Tutorial (41 points | 11 comments)

6. Kastle (YC S24) Is Hiring Engineer #3 ( | hide)
7. Microsoft's 1986 IPO (26 points | 1 comment)
8. Show HN: 10 teams are racing to build a pivotal tracker replacement (20 points | 3 comments)

10. Teach, Don't Tell (2013) (43 points | 7 comments)

13. That Time I Recreated Photoshop in C++ (166 points | 66 comments)
14. Military grade sonic weapon is used against protesters in Serbia (34 points | 6 comments)
15. Local-First and Ejectable (43 points | 8 comments)
16. When the Dotcom Bubble Burst (35 points | 11 comments)

20. "QWERTY wasn't designed to solve type bar jamming" [pdf] (12 points | 4 comments)

22. Raytracing on Intel's Arc B580 – By Chester Lam (74 points | 46 comments)
23. Laplacian Mesh Smoothing by Throwing Vertices (3 points | discuss)
24. Did the Particle Go Through the Two Slits, or Did the Wave Function? (97 points | 91 comments)
25. Leaked Apple meeting shows how dire the Siri situation is (12 points | 4 comments)
26. Building a Personal Archive with Hoarder (27 points | 1 comment)
27. Show HN: Cppmatch – Rust-Like Pattern Matching and Error Handling for C++ (14 points | discuss)
28. "Wait, not like that": Free and open access in the age of generative AI (79 points | 15 comments)
29. Peru's Great Urban Experiment (2023) (39 points | 9 comments)
30. A Princely Ploy: Inside the Ruse of a French-Armenian Scammer (26 points | 2 comments)
